Stayed a few nights
review_text: What a gem of a place! Michael's apartment was everything we could have hoped for during our short stay. The location is second to none, nestled in a lively neighborhood with plenty of dining options just a stone's throw away. The apartment itself boasts a modern, stylish decor that makes you feel both comfortable and a bit luxurious at the same time. The kitchen was equipped with high-end appliances, which we didn’t use much but were impressive to have on hand. Michael, the host, was outstanding - always responsive and genuinely caring about our experience. He also provided great local tips that enhanced our visit. Overall, an impeccable stay that exceeded our expectations. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a top-notch experience in the heart of the city!

review_text:
Our host Michael is wonderful! He gave us detailed recommendations of favorite restaurants etc. Le Diplomate was a standout, Teds Bulletins breakfast and bakery (yum), and for convenience -Amazon Go grocery store was around the corner! The apartment is beautiful and comfortable! If you were to cook, you will find the best appliances to make a great meal.
We loved the bathroom tub, bidet and double sinks!
As far as parking, we had a parking pass provided by Michael which was necessary! We had to park two blocks away probably due to our late arrival time but it was not a big deal. The museums are so close we were able to walk to them. The African American History Museum is so amazing...
Thank you Michael!
Rebecca

name: Ben
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: We had a wonderful Christmas stay at Michael's lovely unit in DC. The unit itself was perfect for the two of us. It was spotlessly clean, very well appointed with high quality appliances and furnishings, had a super comfy bed and was quiet and peaceful in the evenings. It really was all that we could have hoped for. The location was great too, with really enjoyable nearby restaurants and groceries all in easy working distance (Whole Foods, Trader Joes, Amazon Fresh). We didn't get a hire car and were quite happy walking and utilizing Ubers to get around. A special callout to the super helpful directions and recommendations that Michael provided before we arrived, they were detailed, useful and interesting (excellent restaurant recommendations too!). Overall we really enjoyed our first trip to DC and when we return we would happily book Michael's unit again when we do. Thanks Michael!

Stayed over a week
review_text: We have stayed at Michael's before and knew what a lovely place we would be staying at. His place is exceptionally clean and well appointed, with extra conveniences that make us feel right at home. We love the kitchen as we like to balance cooking in with going out, especially during longer stays like this one. The location is wonderful. On a quiet street yet so close to shopping and wonderful restaurants. We were there for two weeks and loved that we never once had to use our car having access to a variety of different public transportation nearby. Other pluses for us were having a bathroom with 2 sinks, access to a washer/dryer, king size bed and the fireplace adds a special cozy touch. Better than a 5 star hotel!

This property is perfect if you are staying in DC.

The apartment was in the perfect location; the street was quiet but we were able to walk to almost everything we wanted to do. We will definitely stay here again when we come back to DC to catch all the sights we missed this time! Thank you for a great stay, Michael!

I thoroughly recommend this apartment and only hope that it is available when I want to return!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place was great!! This was our first trip to the DC area and I’m so glad we ended up at Michael’s! The neighborhood is beautiful, the architecture is awesome, and there were tons of bars, restaurants, shopping etc. all within walking distance. We will for sure stay at Michael’s again, or in this neighborhood if we have a larger group. Michael’s place was super clean, stylish, comfortable, and just spot on! Parking on the street was easy early in the day, but about mid afternoon, it fills up pretty quick. We were still able to park within a block away, so it wasn’t a big issue. Michael’s check in instructions are super detailed, so everything was easy, even when we first arrived late at night. No issues whatsoever! It’s also a very safe neighborhood. We walked it late into the night. I could keep going about how great our experience was, but I’m running low on my word count. Bravo Michael! Thanks!

review_text: I absolutely love this apartment and will definitely come back again. There are too many reasons to list all but here are a few. There are heated bathroom floors, and a reclining tub, Viking appliances, and a winer cooler refrigerator. The entrance is lovely as the picture shows. There are two doors providing security and the first door opens into a hallway where you can place your belongings safely before actually getting inside the apartment. All the instructions are complete, accurate and was probably the most well thought out Airbnb in which I have stayed. The location is ideal. Uber arrives within 5 minutes and costs about 12-15 dollars to go around DC downtown and Georgetown. Le Diplomate is a wonderful French restaurant right around the corner. We easily walked back from the Mall a couple times during our stay. We had no reason to contact Michael. All was perfect

review_text: Michael was such a great host. The apartment was unlike any other Airbnb location that I have ever booked or stayed. There isn’t any location like this! The bed was ridiculously comfortable (I have a cervical spine condition which has me feeling pain usually when I sleep) so this was definitely a plus! The kitchen was perfect for cooking and well stocked. I was definitely surprised once I saw that Michael had a lot of amenities (dish washing soap, sponges, etc) that a lot of (Airbnb) listing do not have. The bathroom was clean and stocked. Michael communicated with me weeks prior to arriving and made the check in process so smooth (I have never experienced the level of service Michael provided to me compared to any other location). I found parking right in front of the apartment. Michael also printed out the parking pass for me and dropped it off upon arriving. I will definitely be staying here again! Unfortunately, there is a word limit on Airbnb reviews, but so much good too say!

Highly recommend and we hope to visit again!

My husband and I had an amazing time. The apartment is even better in person! Top of the line appliances, comfortable bed, and outlets galore. There were at least 12 outlets in the bedroom alone!
The neighborhood the apartment is located is perfect. So much fun, inviting, and convenient. So many close restaurants but we never heard anything from the apartment making it ideal of a light sleeper. We also felt very safe the entire time.
Parking was super simple and we found a spot directly in front of the apartment without evening trying. We just left our car parked the entire time as my husband and I are big walkers. We walked the entire time. It was about a 45 minute walk to all of the museums and we enjoyed every minute of it.
Having access to the washer and dryer was also an added bonus. It’s amazing to come back from a vacation without needing to do any laundry!
Michael was a wonderful host and we hope to come back one day.

review_text: This place is gorgeous, I mean really stunning!. Finely appointed with high end finishes and furniture. Michael is super friendly and communicates well, although I wish there had been a sheet of important facts within the apt so we didn't have to bug him. We thought parking on the street might be an issue, but it was not. Heads up on Street Cleaning day as posted and be sure to move your car. The King bed is firm but comfortable. Kitchen is well stocked with efficient appliances. Stacking washer and dryer work excellently. The shower/toilet area is cramped and the higher tub is difficult to enter and exit with no safety bar provided ( Michael says he is contacting his contractor to have a safety bar installed and change out the toilet seat.) The double sinks outside the tub area, while lovely to see are not functional. Flat iron & hairdryer want to slide down into sink as most of the counter area is taken by huge shallow sinks---another safety issue. Extraordinary neighborhood of Victorian rowhouses or walk-ups (not all brownstones) that are lovingly being restored, some with courtyards in front , charming landscaping and old brick walkways. Location is excellent as we were mainly on the National Mall at David's Tent (10 min. drive )and found yummy restaurants at Michael's kind suggestion right around the corner. Thanks again Michael and Toby!

Joe lives in the unit above and is on hand to answer questions and troubleshoot if needed. (LOL, I had problems figuring out the Roku!) But he also gives you your space and privacy. We would stay here again in a heartbeat and recommend Joe's place for couples and singles looking to have a wonderful stay in D.C.

The space was beautifully and functionally decorated, with a great location to attractions and restaurants, and in a safe location. We even got the chance to meet and chat with Joe, who was engaging and couldn't have been more hospitable, even in mid-stay. Thanks Joe! We plan to be back soon, and will reccomend you to personal friends! As for this community, all these reviews should tell you what you need to know. Just an amazing experience all around!

Edith and her place in Washington is Perfect! She has thought of every amenity that you will need and made sure it was of high quality. We felt like we were at home the second we walked in the door.
The location is perfect! We walked everywhere! To the Capital, museums even walked home from a NHL game at the arena. If walking isn’t your thing then there are scooters to hire everywhere.
If you are a light sleeper bring ear plugs as you will hear footsteps above you. However it’s not bad and stops early in the night.
Edith communicated with us to let us know she was having people over so the noise might be a bit louder than normal however ensured it would be done early enough. which was nice and we had tickets to go out anyways.
Don’t pass up this gem! We will definitely stay again.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
From the day I made the reservation, Edith was so friendly and helpful. She asked why we were coming to DC so she could offer recommendations for us. When she found out that our family had shared interested, she offered extra hospitality - and I'm sad we couldn't work out the timing, but... next time!
The property is immaculate and has everything you need for a stay in Washington. The hosts even offer two Metro cards loaded with some $$ so you can get around. We travel to the area enough that we have our own Metro cards, but no host has ever offered this during our prior stays. If it's your first time, you'll appreciate it.
The kitchen is well-stocked with coffee, tea, sugar, etc. We were attending a conference, so ate many meals there, so we didn't cook, but did find a GEM of a local Indian restaurant called Indigo. It's walking distance, family-owned, affordable, & the food is delicious.
This is a great property & we'll certainly stay here on our next visit!

So much so that we didn’t need assistance during the visit. We felt right at home and loved having a cozy place to recover each night after a long day exploring. The location is fantastic- we ate at several walkable restaurants for dinners (such a cute neighborhood) and appreciated the short walk to Union station where we caught the Metro to head to the museums. Honestly, the first trip was a bit challenging for us, but we caught on quickly and appreciated the use of the metro cards. One morning we stopped first at the Library of Congress (only because Edith recommended it on the listing). Wow- certainly worth seeing! (It required a free timed entry pass like many of the museums, but was easy to get.) We’d love to come back and see more.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
One of the best Airbnb stays I've been!
I first want to highlight how responsive and kind Edith and her husband were. My husband and I were messaging them weeks before our arrival due to our travel schedule, and they were always accomodating and understanding.
Secondly, their listing was absolutely clean and felt like staying at home. We were in DC for 5 days so it was important for us to have a cozy, comfortable place where we can get groceries (Trader Joe's is ~1 mile away). Major brownie points for having access to the laundry!
Thirdly, the location was amazing. We didn't rent a car or take public transportation (we LOVE walking). We were able to get around just by walking, which felt so great considering that where I'm from is not a walk-friendly city.
We highly recommend this place and we'd definitely come stay at Edith's again!

Thank you for an amazing stay, Edith :) The accommodation was generously sized, pristine, quiet, and comfortable. From providing public transport cards that we could use, to a map on the wall where previous guests could put a pin to show where they are from, every detail is thought out.
Location is great, walking distance to the Metro, Capitol Hill and all the main attractions. If you can't get there walking, you can easily catch the subway. Some great food options in the area too - Ted's Bulletin for breakfast or Cafe Berlin for a German dinner. That said the kitchen is also well equipped if you'd prefer a night in.
Would not hesitate to stay here again and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone considering staying.
Thank you again Edith, and all the best.
Tom and Renata

review_text: I have stayed at several AirBNB locations both in the US and Europe and I can honestly say that the attention and service from Edith surpassed all of the hosts with whom I have dealt. It's a great location with a 10 minute walk to either the Capitol South or Union Station Metro stops, and several bus lines available nearby. Great set up for 2-3 people. Would give 6 stars if that were possible. Thank you Edith and Mark!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

·

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This spot in DC is an absolute GEM! A 10 min walk to good food near a metro, 5 min walk to a metro that goes to Union, and the walk straight to Union is reasonable as well- I think it was a 15 min walk. I felt pretty safe, which you can’t say about many places in DC.
The bed was so comfortable and the place was clean. Check-in was easy and we were left feeling very satisfied with the spot.
A few notes but not dealbreakers:
- The water pressure was subpar. I have VERY chick hair, so I couldn’t wash my hair on the trip. Not a big deal- I even found dry shampoo in the bathroom. I noticed the water pressure issue everywhere we went, so I think it might be an issue everywhere.
- We brought most of our clothes on hangers, but felt like we had limited space to hang them.
- The freezer in the mini fridge is very small.
Nearby food: We ate at Santa Rosa Taqueria, Good Stuff, and Union Pub. All so good! Look for Happy Hour anytime you eat or drink!
We would definitely stay here again!

Loved my time spent here! Some specific highlights for me: nice heavy comforter that helped me fall right to sleep, 2 pillows that were super soft + squishy and 2 that were firm and supportive, and the big thing for me was the floor fan that provided the perfect amount of white noise to make my nervous system feel comfortable in a foreign space.
Edith was very lovely to me. I found her to be helpful, responsive, and personable.
I will definitely stay here again if it's available during Rare Disease Week on Capital Hill 2024!

Edith left us lots of tips and helpful info in the welcome binder as well as a couple of metro cards which we quickly learned to use and even left a few dollars on for the next guests. We would recommend this unit to anyone looking for a peaceful getaway close to the iconic DC landmarks. Our only cautionary reminder would be that it is a basement unit, so we were able to tell when the family was home/moving about above us but we would consider this very standard and did not mind at all. Our entire experience was pleasant, the check in & out were super easy and we would definitely stay here again.

The location is perfect to explore Adams Morgan/north Kalorama—very walkable and close to excellent restaurants, but removed enough to feel away from the crowds. At night, traffic to/from the Ellington Bridge can be heard—that’s the only negative I encountered here, and it didn’t bother me overall. Andrea and Margaret were very responsive and clearly take pride in their space. I look forward to returning!

review_text: Andrea and Margaret's place is one of the best bnb's I've stayed in! Very clean and comfortable, and tastefully furnished. We hung out with our family for the most part, but I took note of a well supplied kitchen if I were wanting to prepare meals. I loved the roomy bathroom as well as a decent size closet for clothing. The location is great (not just because my family lives a block away, but it's super accessible to many locations in DC. Andrea and Margaret were also very responsive to any questions we had. This place will definitely be my first choice next time I head to DC.

There’s a nearby garage on the other side of the Duke Ellington Memorial Bridge that made parking so much easier for us. We would love to return the next time we need a place to stay in DC.

name: Jonathan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Where do I even begin? This is a GEM! Check in was easy, host was so responsive, sweet, and prepared. Once I walked into the space I was immediately impressed by how clean and pristine the space was! Not only was it tastefully decorated (okay, this is one of the cutest places I've seen) it was set up with all essentials for travelers. LOCATION! Nestled in the cutest, most walkable area (Adams Morgan) I was able to get around on foot easily. There is so much to check out literally just down the street locally or a quick 10-20min walk down the way. If you are looking to make great memories and take phenomenal pictures, this is certainly the place/area for you. Everything is so picturesque even in the rain. It was always nice to come back to such a clean and cozy place after a long day of exploring. I can't rave about the place enough. This is my top place to book for my next visit - hands down!

review_text: I love this place because it’s so accessible by Metro or Uber to all the obvious DC tourist attractions, but more than that because it’s tucked away in a less touristy, local gem of a neighborhood. Adams Morgan was lively and had lots to see and do, but this charming apartment was located in a quieter pocket and provided a very comfortable (and affordable) stay. Hosts were always responsive and accommodating, yet our stay still felt very private. Next time I get back to DC, I will 100% stay here again.

review_text: The apartment is a beautiful and very thoughtfully furnished in-law in the hip/alternative Adams Morgan district. Buses run in front of the doorstep, the subway is in walking distance. The connection to all the attractions is straightforward. The apartment was sparkling clean and is furnished and equipped with a lot of love for detail - everything we needed (including things like laundry detergent/sink tabs or coffee pods) were available. We had a very nice time there.

The apartment has everything you need for cooking and is super connected. Within walking distance (15 minutes walk) is the metro with which you can be in the city center very quickly. There is also a pharmacy, as well as a supermarket where you can stock up on your needs. Two streets full of restaurants are also just around the corner (at the metro station/Connecticut Ave NW and 18th St NW)

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a perfect location for exploring the sights of DC. Less than 10 minutes walk from the subway, which itself is only a few stops from DC centre and if you prefer to walk, a only 2.0 miles to the White House. The accommodation, whilst compact has been thoughtfully created. Only a few minutes walk from multiple restaurants, cafes and supermarkets too. The finishing touches are excellent; everything described in the advert but also some wonderful surprises such as the comprehensive device charging dock and the two drawers full of coffee and tea pods to name but two. The hosts are particularly responsive and we can’t recommend this property highly enough if you’re ever in need of a spot close to DC centre. We would love to come back!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Character shows up in a crisis, and for that, Andrea & Margaret get 10 stars. With severe storms and 80 mph winds in the area, they alerted us when an alarm suggested possible flooding in the space. When we confirmed, they immediately took care of us with a last minute relocation. BEFORE that, we found the space to be great, with personal touches. (And so appreciate umbrellas, since we forgot ours). The neighborhood is fantastic, and there is so much to do for eating, people watching, shopping or getting into the downtown DC area.

review_text: This place was perfect for my wife and I for 4 nights in DC. Well located for local shops and restaurants and a short walk to the Metro. The apartment itself was superbly equipped with everything we could need and really well set out and planned. Even in a hot July the apartment felt cool and when it was warm the AC was quiet and effective. Communication from the host was first rate throughout and they even offered earlier check in without us requesting it which is a good indicator of how thoughtful they were. We would rebook without a second thought if we return to DC.

review_text: The Calvert Cottage is everything you could wish for and more in an AirBnb. If I could give it 6 stars, I would. The hosts have created a wonderful space that is comfortable, spotless, convenient, quiet, and truly a home-away-from-home. Having the washer/dryer was priceless for a longer stay! The hosts were responsive and immensely helpful. My husband and I stayed for 6 nights and would stay again in a heartbeat. The Cottage is a short walk to the Metro and a shorter walk to the Circulator bus system. There were many great restaurants in both directions and a Safeway just a short walk away. We give Andrea & Margret and the Calvert Cottage our highest recommendation! Thank you for your hospitality and kindness!!

We appreciated that there were two luggage racks in the large closet so we could stow our items out of sight. We'd stay here for future DC trips!

review_text: The Calvert Street Cottage is a home away from home. It has all the amenities and conveniences to make for a comfortable long-term stay. We appreciated the full service kitchen and the washer/dryer unit in the cottage. It served our needs well. The highlight for us was the location. It was within a quarter of a mile from our son's studio apartment, and yes, our place was bigger than his. Andrea and Margaret are responsive, personable hosts. We highly recommend the Calver Street Cottage for a comfortable stay in Washington, D.C.

review_text:
Andrea & Margaret's AirBnB was in the heart of the Adams Morgan section of Washington D.C. which was very walkable, to get to many restaurants, bars, Safeway grocery, and CVS. The metro train stop is about a 10 minute walk from the AirBnB, which will connect any visitors to the rest of Washington. The National Zoo is only a 15 minute walk from the AirBnB. The AirBnB was very clean, and the shower in the bathroom was exceptional !!
The washer and dryer in the AirBnB was an added bonus for our 1 week stay. The AirBnB was just the right size for 2 people. Thank You Andrea and Margaret for making our stay in the nation's capital a wonderful one !

Andrea & Margaret let us drop off our luggage before check-in, and also gave us early access to the space, which was a big help on a cold grey day. Communication from booking to check-out was strong. The bed was comfortable, and the grandson did fine on the couch. Public transit, groceries, as well as many restaurants and shops are all short walks. Whenever we needed a Lyft/Uber, it never took more than a few minutes. We hope to stay again.

review_text:
This place is a gem.
First the location is incredible. The house is located in a serene and picturesque neighborhood. Only a few blocks from the house you will find abundance of nice restaurants and cafes, grocery stores and little shops. You will also find attractions within walking distance such as Rock Creek Park, National Zoo, Embassy Row, and Dupont Circle to name a few. If you need to travel further there are several bike stations nearby.
The room is very specious and lovely. It looked even nicer than pictured. It is thoughtfully decorated and fully stocked with everything you will need to feel at home.
Last but not least, the hosts are wonderful. From the thoughtful way the room is designed and the communications I had with them, I could tell the hosts genuinely care about their guests and would do everything to make sure their guests enjoy their stay.
If your are brining your car I suggest you look into public parking because street parking will be almost impossible. I brought my car and left it in a parking deck for the duration of my stay.
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and can't recommend it enough!

review_text:
Had an absolutely wonderful stay at Andrea & Margaret's cottage and it will be the first place I look to stay anytime I visit DC in the future!
My partner and I arrived here at the end of a long 3 week trip and it couldn't have been a more relaxing and pleasant place to stay. Comfortable bed and couch, wonderfully decorated, coffee, washer and dryer, and any and all extras you could think of (we loved the popcorn!)
Despite technically being a studio, the unit is quite large and was more than enough space for the two of us.
The location was great; we intended to spend a lot of time in Georgetown, which was easily accessible by Uber and bike. We also biked to the National Mall and Smithsonian museums without a problem. The Adams Morgan neighborhood felt safe and lively, and was picturesque given the seasonal fall weather.
Communication was great and Andrea & Margaret were exceptional hosts. We really hope to stay here again!

name: Blake
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This was one of the best Airbnb experiences I’ve ever had. The space itself was clean and spacious for a basement apartment and is exactly as the listing shows. The bed was very comfortable and we had plenty of pillows and blankets to choose from. The kitchen is well stocked, the TV has a ton of channels, they provided coffee and tea for the Keurig, and the rainfall showerhead was a nice way to relax at the end of a day of walking. Andrea and Margaret have obviously worked very hard to make sure their guests have a great stay - they went way beyond providing the basics and it’s the small touches that turn a good stay into a great stay. They provided umbrellas, a yoga mat, toiletries if you forgot anything at home (like my toothbrush), filtered water in the fridge, and basic pantry staples.
The location cannot be beat and I thought the price was a great value. Check-in was a breeze and they were great about communicating before, during, and after our stay. Adams Morgan is a great neighborhood with so many restaurants and bars within walking distance of the apartment. The metro stop is about a 10 minute walk or Uber was always available within a few minutes.

Being an old building, there were some quirky things like the lights flashed sometimes. Heat is hard to regulate in old buildings so we appreciated the space heater as it could get chilly in the living room/kitchen space. The TV wasn't super great so we ended up watching streaming services on our own devices. We liked the kitchen space as it had everything we needed for our week-long stay. Again, the value was worth it for the amenities and location!

Rating, 4 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Ann is very friendly, nice, and super responsive. The location is perfect. Close to the metro, with great restaurants and shopping a block away, and the neighborhood is really cute. The kitchen has everything you need to cook. The kitchen and bathroom surfaces were very clean.
The unit is affordable and geared towards work trips. The bed is pushed against two closet doors that have the water heater and furnace inside, it can be a little noisy. A major concern I had was that the unit did not have any smoke detectors (they were removed by the owner) and no C02 detector in the unit, which did not make me feel safe considering the utilities are directly next to the bed. There also was not a deadbolt in the back door leading to the owner's basement and exit (only a doorknob lock). In general, the unit felt a little unmaintained (lots of dust, rusty and dirty vents, and generally a little beaten up), but that might be fine for budget travelers!

The neighborhood is also wonderful very walkable and quiet but also close enough to a group of bars and restaurants that you still have stuff to do. The public transportation access is also great its about a 10-minute walk to the U Street Metro station and about the same amount of time time to a bus stop I didn't drive at all when I was there and loved every minute of it. The place was tidy and comfortable with a cute little bench out front that is great for morning coffee.
I would recommend Anne’s place 100% the next time you are in the DC area.

Ann's place was perfect for the few days I spent in DC. The location is a short walk from many restaurants and shops and a very manageable walk to the National Mall and other DC sights. Logan Circle is a beautiful neighborhood, and I was excited that Ann's place is so centrally located. The unit itself was very clean and exactly as described. The unit was quiet and cozy and had everything we needed.
The best part of the stay was Ann. She was incredibly proactive in providing information about parking (including street cleaning restrictions), public transportation, and other nearby amenities. She respected our privacy but went above and beyond to ensure that our needs were met and that we had a relaxing stay. Looking forward to staying here again on our next visit! Thank you, Ann!

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Unwelcoming and Noisy. I couldn’t sleep with the heavy walkers upstairs. I could hear their shower running, dogs claws on the floors, the television, people talking, all above the bedroom as early as 5 AM. I tried to sleep in the front room to avoid the noise but Noise was everywhere. I’m a super host and always check in with my guests to make sure all is good. I never heard from my hostess during my short stay. I wanted to LEAVE earlier. Mind the heavy clamps holding the headboard together. Don’t hurt yourself. This is a place to store your luggage only not for resting after a long day of sightseeing. I could only sleep on the metro and missed my stop. No brochures about how to get around town, the metro, or sights to see. Responses from hostess were short, curt, and as little as two words. I bumped into the husband outside and first words out of his mouth he asked me if I had been vaccinated. - instead of asking me how my stay was going. I hope I never have this experience again at a BNB .

review_text: We were very satisfied with the apartment. It is a spacious basement with a separate bedroom with a lovely bed, a living room, kitchen and bathroom (shower, sink and toilet). The apartment has all the comforts and has good wifi. You have access to the garden. It is located in a nice neighborhood and close by is a supermarket and a cozy nightlife street. The residents have provided a folder with good tips about restaurants and other information you may need. Also they have provided cards with balance for public transportation. That's very nice because then you can travel right away and you don't have to arrange that yourself first. With several bus lines, you can travel to the sights. It is also very nice that we were allowed to leave our luggage a little longer because we didn't leave until later in the day. We would like to stay here again next time and highly recommend this apartment. Best wishes to Jen and John.

The location is great, with multiple bus stops nearby, many restaurants (we loved The DINER on 18th St!), and a grocery store a block away. Jennifer and John were very responsive and nice enough to offer early check in and to store our luggage after check out.

review_text: Fantastic hosts great location would stay there again in a heartbeat. Jennifer helped me with early drop off of luggage. Great recommendations for museums, and she and her husband were just warm and friendly. Couldn't have asked for better hosts. The location is in the heart of Adam Morgan and we went to some great restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance that really made it easy to relax after a full day of Museums. Uber to the Smithsonian's and monuments was $10-$15 but the location is also 3 minutes from a $2 bus ride that takes you to the capital. The hosts provide you with smart trip cards that can be used on the metro or bus just refill back to $20 at the end. It's a little thoughtful gestures like these I really made the stay relaxing. Thanks for hosting a great location.

To get to your big buildings and monuments such as The White House and Washington Monument it'll take you about half an hour, or public transport is very easy to get to.
Jen and John themselves are brilliant hosts, who communicate very well, provide a spotless property with all the amenities you could need and plenty of local recommendations for a very enjoyable stay in Washington DC. If we are ever in the area again we would stay here!

They also provided good information on how to get around the city and provided metro passes for renters to use. There were also snacks provided and coffee with cream. The only downside to the place is that the kitchen is a bit cramped for counter space to prepare food, but that was also clearly stated in the listing. It would not change if we were happy there, it is merely inconvenient. We also requested and were granted a late check out which helped make our last day there easier. We would definitely stay here when we return to DC.

name: Tracia
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
What a great place to stay in DC!
Location: It is a close walk to the Adams Morgan neighborhood, which is a fun place to go to bars and for shopping. From here, you also have easy access to the bus or Metro. Jennifer is kind enough to provide Metro cards for you to use during your stay and reload before you leave. Those were very handy!
Apartment: It's a quaint and cozy little 1-bedroom apartment with a full kitchen which worked well for us to make breakfast every morning before we went sightseeing. It also has a nice living room and a patio for relaxing after a day of sightseeing. The wi-fi and the AC worked very well.
The owners: They lived in the house above the apartment. We talked with them the first day we arrived and they were very nice. We were on our honeymoon and they were nice enough to leave us a gift of Prosecco to toast on our first night in DC. They offered us good advice on how to get started on our vacation. They were also very respectful of our privacy during our stay.
Affordability: The apartment was very affordable compared to others I looked at.
We would definitely recommend this to any couple wanting to visit DC!

review_text: We stayed for a month and Jen's place easily exceeded our expectations. We split our time between work and leisure. I cannot think of anything that needed to be improved. It is a bit of a walk to the nearest metro but we like to walk and found that enjoyable and safe. There is a large grocery store is a block away. Everything else that we needed was very near on 18th Street or Columbia Road. Great restaurants and bars in the area. Jen's communication was always quick and helpful. There's some good info on DC and the neighborhood in the apartment too. The Metro cards were a nice added touch. We definitely would stay here again and hope to when next in DC.

This is a great airbnb in the Adams Morgan neighborhood. The queen size bed was comfortable. Plenty of storage space for clothing and a comfortable chair in the bedroom. The galley kitchen is small, but everything you need is there. The living room is spacious with comfortable seating. Restaurants, bars, shops and grocers are within a short walking distance. Great neighborhood. We even walked to the zoo.
A great place to stay. The owners have thought of everything to meet your needs.

name: Lisa
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The place is GREAT! I think it’s actually a bit bigger in person than in the pics! Every essential tool you would need is in the kitchen, washer/dryer, separate bedroom (my son opted to sleep on the pull out couch in the living room). It’s quiet and just SO charming! The bed was also REALLY comfortable. My son and I walked and biked a lot. This place is only 1.4 miles from the National Mall, but everyone in the city seems to rent bikes, electric bikes and electric scooters. They are pretty cheap and you can be downtown at the tourist attractions and restaurants in 10 min! Beats using Uber/Lyft. You also don’t want to lose your parking spot near the place once you find one, which we found to be easy at 4 pm. You can literally pick up a bike or scooter anywhere in eyesight in the city and take it anywhere else for a very cheap price! We did bike down one night (because it was mostly downhill) for dinner and took a Lyft back because we were full and it was dark. 😂 we did a LOT right around the apartment though! TONS of eateries are within 4-7 min walking distance! We needed a CVS for something, I wanted to get some groceries to make breakfast…… it’s all SO close! There’s a Trader Joe’s and Target close to there as well, but we didn’t go. The hosts do provide a visitor parking pass for street parking and metro cards if you need them. They also don’t charge a cleaning fee, so I cleaned up a little extra before leaving! If I EVER stay in DC again, this will be the place! WONDERFUL hosts!!!

Came to spend some time in DC with my boyfriend, we had a blast. This Airbnb was so cozy, cute, and clean! we didn't have any problems with noise at all, even though it was right on a street light corner. The permit parking the host provided was very convenient as well. The apartment was also spacious, perfect for couples. The room was very big and kitchen was super cute!!
We drove here so everything was pretty quick to get to. I wouldn't say DC is walkable but with the electric bikes/scooters everything is about 10min from this Airbnb! close to grocery stores (like 4 min walk ). It's the perfect place to stay to hit the capitol building, Smithsonian museums and staton park (which I heard is beautiful for the cherry blossoms).

review_text: Graham is probably the most responsive and proactive host I’ve experienced with Airbnb! He provided detailed information before we even arrived so there were no questions about where to park and how to get in. Plus he gave us GREAT restaurant recommendations that ended up being delicious. The place is walkable to the National Mall, but there are also bus stops directly in front of the apartment and Union station was an easy walk. There was a sports bar called The Big Board underneath the airbnb that didn’t get too loud, but was amazing when we wanted some late night bites or a night cap, and was awesome to something have that close after a day of driving when we first got in. The owners there were also super nice and recognized us the 2nd time we came by. I loved the street we were on. The homes had super pretty architecture and there were so many shops, restaurants, and fitness studios nearby. We LOVED the outdoor patio on the roof. Grab a bottle of wine & enjoy the view like we did!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I liked the location at Graham's place a lot.
Once I learned the best route to Capitol Hill, it was less than a 10 minute walk. Union Station is very convenient as well and the Red to Yellow lines were a quick, easy, and cheap way to Reagan National. It took me 1/2 hour total from when I left the house to landing at the airport (of course some of that was due to luck and timing). I'd give 45 minutes for an early morning commute to DCA.
The unit does face two busy streets and it was a bit noisy until 11:00 midweek but it settled down after that. I typically am not very sensitive to noise I can do nothing about.
Graham's place was comfortable and clean and a real plus to have a washer, dryer, and dishwasher in the unit.
The TV worked. Although when presented with two remotes I usually pick up the wrong one and start punching buttons and it takes awhile to get myself out of a TV pickle. It didn't take long and all my favorite channels were there.
I would definitely stay there again.

review_text:
Washington D.C. Gem: Cozy Studio, Great Value, Friendly Host

My husband & I recently stayed at this charming studio apartment in Washington D.C. and had an absolutely wonderful experience.
The apartment was in a fantastic location, within walking distance to The Mall and all the museums and monuments as well as Union Station. The neighborhood had tons restaurants and markets with a real neighborhood feeling. It felt safe and quiet, yet still close to the action.
Graham & Bear were incredibly friendly and helpful. They were always available to answer questions and offer recommendations, making us feel right at home.
The studio itself was small but perfectly appointed with everything we needed for a comfortable stay. It was clean, well-maintained, and had a warm and inviting atmosphere. The Rooftop deck was a nice treat and I'm sure even better when the weather is more cooperative.
When we are back in the D.C. area we will stay no where else.

Wonderful stay. Very clean, linens were top notch, this was one of our favorite Airbnb’s we’ve stayed at. Everything was thought of…from snacks, laundry detergent, baggies, extra toiletries, full kitchen, everything was upgraded like a 5 star hotel. We asked for fans for white noise and he provided 2 sleeping machines along with a purifier for noise.
It’s a very walkable area, I never felt unsafe. There are grocery stores and many restaurants that are walkable. I cannot comment about buses/Metro as we walked everywhere or used Uber/Lyft/Empower. If I had to give feedback on something it would be that the internet was pretty slow and there was no full length mirror.
We will definitely stay here again when we return.

Jason's Airbnb exceeded all expectations. From the moment I arrived, I was blown away by the beauty and comfort of the space. The host put a lot of thought and care into every detail, creating an inviting and luxurious atmosphere.
Jason is friendly and responsive, ensuring I had a seamless experience.
Thanks to the clear instructions, the check-in process was easy. The well-maintained property and welcoming neighborhood made me feel completely at ease and secure throughout my stay.
The place was clean, with every surface spotless. It was clear that the host took great pride in maintaining a welcoming environment. Plus, it was stocked with all the amenities needed for a comfortable and convenient stay, from plush towels to a fully equipped kitchen.
This Airbnb was nothing short of exceptional. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a beautiful, comfortable, hassle-free stay. Thank you, Jason for providing such a wonderful experience!

review_text: We had the best time at Jason’s home! Not only was he a super helpful, friendly, responsive host (he lives just upstairs), but the home is GORGEOUS. It doesn’t feel at all like a lower level space - there’s lots of light (and privacy at the same time). He has thought of everything you might need and included really thoughtful touches - especially in the kitchen but everywhere else too! We loved cooking in the full-size, brand new kitchen with amazing finishes but also loved that we could deliver anything we wanted (it was snowy and cold and we have a small baby) and get it delivered in no time OR walk to dozens + restaurants! We hope to stay again and cannot recommend Jason and his home more enthusiastically!

The host was very responsive, and it's clear that they have put a lot of thought into making the space welcoming and comfortable for guests. Highly recommend.

BEAUTIFUL updated kitchen, gorgeous and convenient neighbourhood (so many bars, restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores within 10 minutes, conference center within 20 minutes walk). Walkable to some of DC's biggest attractions as well! Everything down to the shower head and water pressure was amazing. I cannot recommend it enough!!!
Jason was always so responsive and helpful. I was visiting DC for a conference, and his place made for a very relaxing place to unwind after a busy day, I felt right at home.

review_text:
We can’t recommend this place enough. The host has thought of everything. We arrived late after a long day of travel and were pleasantly surprised that there were a number of snacks for us to fill our bellies before bed. The entire place was spotless and welcoming and made us feel right at home. The king size bed was very comfortable and made for great sleeping. The shower has excellent water pressure the bathroom is well stocked with all the amenities a traveler would need.
We woke to find a Keurig with plenty of coffee and tea options. There are also a number of sauces and seasonings and a beautiful new cooking range for anyone looking to do their own cooking.
The location was excellent with lots of public transportation and food options within a few minute walk.
Jason was easy to get ahold of and quick to respond. Don’t give it a second thought, book while it’s available as this gem will book up quickly!
